ai-dn18:28.1_0: That is the topic on which Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra spoke. And while he was speaking on that topic, this thought came to the great king Vessavaṇa,
ai-dn18:28.2_0: “It’s incredible, it’s amazing! That there should be such a magnificent Teacher, and such a magnificent exposition of the teaching! And that such achievements of high distinction should be made known!”
ai-dn18:28.3_0: And then Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra, knowing what the great king Vessavaṇa was thinking, said to him,
ai-dn18:28.4_0: “What do you think of the great king Vessavaṇa? That’s the great king who came to luxury such a high distinction?
ai-dn18:28.5_0: In the future, too, there will be such a magnificent Teacher, and such a magnificent exposition of the teaching! And such achievements of high distinction will be made known!”
ai-dn18:29.1_0: That, sir, is the topic on which Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra spoke to the gods of the Thirty-Three. And the great king Vessavaṇa, having heard and learned it in the presence of Brahmā as he was speaking on that topic, informed his own assembly.’”
ai-dn18:29.2_0: And the spirit Janavasabha, who had heard and learned it in the presence of the Buddha, informed the great king of Janavasana.
ai-dn18:29.3_0: And the Buddha, having heard and learned it in the presence of the spirit Janavasabha, and also from his own direct knowledge, informed Venerable Ānanda. And Venerable Ānanda, having heard and learned it in the presence of the Buddha, informed the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.
ai-dn18:29.4_0: And that’s how this spiritual life has become successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.
ai-dn18:29.5_0: The fifth sub-chapter on Janavasabha is finished.
